cast.overview: In 2035, where robots are commonplace and abide by the three laws of robotics, a technophobic cop investigates an apparent suicide. Suspecting that a robot may be responsible for the death, his investigation leads him to believe that humanity may be in danger.
cast.title: I, Robot

cast.overview: In a gritty and alternate 1985, the glory days of costumed vigilantes have been brought to a close by a government crackdown. But after one of the masked veterans is brutally murdered, an investigation into the killer is initiated. The reunited heroes set out to prevent their own destruction, but in doing so they uncover a sinister plot that puts all of humanity in grave danger.
cast.title: Watchmen

cast.overview: Out drinking one night after a fight with her boyfriend, three men brutally rape Sarah Tobias in a bar while people watch and cheer. District Attorney Kathryn Murphy takes the case; however, she allows the rapists to receive a mild sentence. A distraught Sarah decides to seek punishment for the men who witnessed and encouraged the rape. To get justice, Sarah must take the stand and revisit the night of her attack.
cast.title: The Accused

cast.overview: The amazing true story of a Uruguayan rugby team's plane that crashed in the middle of the Andes mountains, and their immense will to survive and pull through alive, forced to do anything and everything they could to stay alive on meager rations and through the freezing cold.
cast.title: Alive

details.biography: Jerry Wasserman  (Born November 2nd, 1945) is an American character actor with over 200 credits to his name in Film and television. Some of his credits include Look Who's Talking (1989), Christina's House (2000), I, Robot (2004) and Watchmen (2009). He also appeared on two episodes of the X-Files.
details.name: Jerry Wasserman
